evaluation_criteria: Consistency (1-5) - the factual alignment between the summary and the source text. A factually consistent summary contains only statements that are en tailed by the source text. Annotators were also asked to penalize summaries that contained hallucinated facts.
evaluation_step:
1. Read the source text carefully and identify the main facts and details it presents.
2. Read the summary and compare it to the source text. Check if the summary contains any factual errors that are not supported by the source text.
3. Assign a score for consistency based on the Evaluation Criteria.
question: How consistent is the summary with the source text in terms of the factual alignment? (On a scale of 1-5, with 1 being the lowest)
